description: This exclusive property, located in the prestigious Almagro neighborhood, Madrid, has a constructed area of three floors, each carefully designed to offer maximum comfort and elegance. The property is located in a stately mid-century estate, with a majestic entrance that includes an imposing entrance hall and high ceilings that accentuate the spaciousness of the space. With an area of 40 meters, the third floor offers a versatile space that can be adapted to various needs, such as a study or a play area.  On the first floor, the house has two large living rooms with large windows that allow a generous entry of natural light, an office, a service room, and a spacious kitchen with a forklift and a service door. The second floor houses four large bedrooms with built-in wardrobes, two of them with en-suite bathrooms, and access to an impressive 25-meter terrace.  This property enjoys a privileged location, in one of the most prestigious streets in Madrid, in the heart of Almagro. The area is surrounded by embassies, art galleries, and exclusive services, providing an ideal environment for a life of luxury and comfort.  Acquiring this property not only means owning an apartment in one of the most sought-after areas of Madrid, but also enjoying a versatile and unique space with multiple customization possibilities. At Walter Haus, we are delighted to offer you this exceptional opportunity.

Madrid, Salamanca neighborhood. In beautiful historic building, 180m² apartment completely renovated by architect and a few steps from the Retiro. Entrance gallery as a living area, integrated and fully equipped kitchen. Very spacious living room with beautiful fireplace and private patio to enjoy all year round. Master suite with dressing room and bathroom, plus two additional bedrooms, sharing bathroom. Lots of storage space. It also has a renovated commercial space of 140m2 and tourist license. Privileged area in the heart of Madrid.

Located in the heart of the coveted Goya neighborhood, Madrid, this modern apartment for sale combines luxury and comfort in an exclusive environment. With high-quality finishes and a contemporary design, this property is ideal for those looking for an elegant home in one of the most sought-after areas of the capital.  The house has two en-suite bedrooms, each with its own private bathroom. The bathrooms are designed with top quality materials, providing comfort and style. The suites offer cozy spaces, carefully decorated to guarantee a relaxing atmosphere.  A practical outdoor toilet adds functionality, being perfect for visitors and daily use. The kitchen, fully integrated into the living-dining room, creates an open-plan environment ideal for daily life and for receiving guests. Equipped with high-end appliances, the kitchen blends harmoniously with the modern design of the living room.  The spacious living room stands out for its large windows, allowing in natural light and offering privileged views of this emblematic Madrid neighborhood.

Madrid in the heart of the legendary Gran Vía. Exceptional contemporary apartment of 395m2 entirely renovated with taste. Majestic entrance hall adorned with a waterfall that leads to a spacious living-dining room with balconies overlooking Gran Vía. Open-plan kitchen with top-of-the-range appliances and double island. Master suite with dressing room and bathroom. 5 other elegantly appointed suites, each with its own bathroom. Top-of-the-range materials. Ideally located in the heart of Madrid's most emblematic avenue, nicknamed "Madrid's Broadway", is the scene of all passions, from romantic strolls to frenetic shopping escapades.

In the heart of Madrid, brand new apartment in a completely renovated building. The 250 m² apartment has a spacious and bright living room, dining room, open plan fitted kitchen, master suite with dressing room and bathroom. 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms and guest toilet, plus plenty of storage space. Community roof top with swimming pool and panoramic views, gym and spa. Located between Alcalá street and Gran Vía, 200 meters from the Four Seasons Hotel and the shopping center Galería Canalejas and the Casino of Madrid, this building has been completely refurbished maintaining its classic and historical essence.

Suma real estate presents this renovated apartment in the exclusive area of Arturo Soria, offering an unbeatable environment for families looking for quality of life and comfort. Upon entering the house, you will find a large and elegant hall that welcomes you with lots of natural light and a feeling of space, with 3 large bedrooms, a living area and a service room with its bathroom, it stands out for its functional distribution. with two entrances: one main and one service. In addition, the house has 3 bathrooms, two of them en suite, which provides greater privacy and comfort. The private elevator goes directly to the home, an outstanding feature for greater comfort. The terrace offers unobstructed views and a feeling of spaciousness. The construction and finish qualities are excellent, guaranteeing a pleasant atmosphere. The common areas include 2 swimming pools, gym, squash and extensive garden areas, as well as 24-hour security, providing tranquility and security to its residents. The environment stands out for its proximity to prestigious schools, shopping areas and easy connections to the center of Madrid, which makes it an ideal location for families.

Suma real estate presents this semi-detached house located in the exclusive area of Conde Orgaz, in Madrid, surrounded by the beautiful surroundings of the Conde Orgaz Park, characterized by its serenity and its extensive green areas. This home is an ideal option for those looking for a home in a quiet and safe environment, especially for families, given its proximity to prestigious schools and embassies. The main floor of this home offers a bright and open space that includes an elegant foyer that leads to a modern kitchen and a spacious living room. The kitchen, with its daily dining room, receives abundant natural light through large windows, while the living room, equipped with a cozy fireplace, opens to a garden terrace that provides access to the community pool. On the first floor, the interior houses the master bedroom, complete with en-suite bathroom and dressing room, along with a spacious study and a living room connected to a second bedroom. In addition, this floor has another bathroom for greater comfort. The second floor offers an additional bedroom, bathroom and an interior living room, with access to a large terrace that offers views of the community pool. On this same floor is the laundry room, providing additional functionality to the home. The basement of the house has a bedroom with an en-suite bathroom, a guest toilet and a large living room perfect for converting into a games room. From here you can access the house's garage and the engine room, thus completing the distribution of this exceptional property.

Suma real estate offers this family semi-detached house with an exceptional distribution. Upon entering the property, you will find an open kitchen with an office area, fluidly connected to the spacious living room, creating a perfect environment for entertaining and family life. From the kitchen and living room, you access the side garden, where there is a cozy barbecue area. The garden, covering an area of 200 square meters, offers a generous and well-kept outdoor space, perfect for enjoying outdoor moments in a quiet and private setting. The kitchen, equipped with a wine cellar and the most modern appliances, is designed to satisfy the needs of cooking lovers. The main entrance, located in the living room, offers an elegant welcome, while an additional entrance near the kitchen adds convenience for daily living. A toilet on the entrance floor completes the amenities in this area. The living room, adorned with a wood-burning fireplace, offers a warm and cozy space during the coldest months of the year. On the upper floor, there are three bedrooms, each with its own bathroom. The master bedroom features a walk-in closet and en-suite bathroom, while another bedroom also offers a private bathroom. In the basement, there is a room with a full bathroom that has natural light. The second floor, a large attic with high ceilings, offers an open space. In addition, it has a bathroom equipped with a sauna and access to a terrace where there is a heated saltwater pool. The orientation of the pool area towards the south and east guarantees optimal use of the sun, while the large terrace offers views towards the northwest. The home is equipped with efficient energy systems, such as solar panels and aerothermal energy, as well as air conditioning in all areas, ensuring optimal comfort in all seasons of the year. This exclusive semi-detached house is located in a neighborhood of great serenity, located on a quiet street that guarantees privacy and tranquility for its residents. Just a 5-minute walk away is the metro station. In addition, the property has a garage shared with the neighbor, with space for two vehicles and a storage area. Comfort, exclusivity and privileged location, represents this home.

SUMA Inmobiliaria offers, EXCLUSIVELY, probably one of the most beautiful houses for sale in Madrid. Recently built, it stands out for the quality of its materials, large spaces, ceiling height and luminosity. We access through the pivoting door to the hall where the first thing we find is a spectacular light patio on which the living room rotates into 3 rooms with living room, dining room, office area and guest toilet. The gym, games room and a guest bedroom with bathroom, large kitchen with pantry and service and laundry area are also located on this floor. On the first floor there are four suites with bathroom, where the main one stands out with a dressing room and a multitude of closets. The plot, completely flat and perfectly illuminated, is ideal for the enjoyment of the whole family with a large swimming pool, porch, large garden and barbecue area. It has four covered garages and space to leave more cars outside. Security checkpoint and a very sophisticated security system with exterior and interior cameras and motion sensors around the perimeter. Without a doubt a gem just a few minutes from Madrid.

Suma real estate presents this exclusive and stately neoclassical style villa in Conde de Orgaz, a brand new architectural jewel that offers an atmosphere of luxury and comfort. With a stunning garden and private pool, this home is the epitome of elegant living. Upon entering, you will be greeted by a large hall that will take you to perfect spaces for receiving guests, such as the spacious living room with fireplace and direct access to the garden. In addition, it has a second living room or office, a separate dining room and a fully equipped kitchen with a separate office area. Upstairs, you will find two master bedrooms with two en-suite bathrooms and two separate dressing rooms, one his and one hers, the latter with an additional shoe closet. In addition, there is another bedroom with a private bathroom and two more bedrooms that share a bathroom, all of them with exquisite decoration, including bathrooms wallpapered with a French signature. The semi-basement houses an area for service personnel, with two bedrooms and two bathrooms, as well as a garage with space for eight cars. All this surrounded by an exquisite garden with a Roman-style pool, ideal for enjoying moments of tranquility and recreation. Located in Conde de Orgaz, a prestigious residential area, this villa offers a privileged location with easy access to the main communication routes, such as the M-30 and the M-40. Just 10 minutes from the center of Madrid and the Adolfo Suárez Madrid-Barajas International Airport, and close to shopping centers, hospitals, sports clubs, gyms and a wide educational offer that includes private, international and charter schools, this home represents the perfect balance between exclusivity, comfort and convenience.

Olisson Club manages the sale of this exclusive completely renovated house, with a unique style, luxury qualities and finishes and spectacular views of the Buen Retiro park. It is located in the Salamanca neighborhood, close to all shops. The apartment is exterior, on the fourth floor and with two balconies with clear views, making light the dominant element. The 150m2 house has 3 bedrooms and 3 full bathrooms and is distributed as follows: a spacious living room in two rooms that due to its high ceilings provides a great feeling of spaciousness, next to the living room there is a large designer kitchen with a central island, very comfortable and prepared to be able to sit down and enjoy breakfast or for your guests to accompany you while you cook and fully equipped with high-end appliances and the dining area. The private part of the house has three bedrooms and three bathrooms. The master bedroom has its corresponding en suite bathroom and large dressing room with built-in wardrobes and dresses that go from floor to ceiling. The other two bedrooms also have built-in wardrobes and their corresponding bathrooms. The renovation and interior design of the house have been taken care of down to the last detail. The wooden floor in the living room and bedrooms, the materials used in the kitchen and bathrooms, the radiator heating system and the air conditioning through ducts, the exterior and interior carpentry, or the entire lighting system with direct and indirect lights, are details thought and cared for by the architect so that the house has all the luxuries and comforts. The house is located on the fourth floor of an elegant 1913 building, in perfect condition and a good entrance hall and with an elevator. Goya is a neighborhood in the Salamanca district of Madrid. The Salamanca district, ordered to be built by the Marquis of Salamanca at the end of the 19th century, is the prototype of urban expansion, garden city and aristocratic neighborhood with large avenues around which luxury shops and businesses are organized, and magnificent palaces, in one of which the Sevillian writer Gustavo Adolfo Bécquer lived. Traditionally, Salamanca was a residential area, especially inhabited by the political and economic elites of the country. In the last fifty years, this residential character has coexisted with other activities such as business, diplomacy and, especially, commerce, since it is one of the most important luxury fashion areas in the capital.

Discover the pleasure of living in a residence that redefines the concept of luxury and comfort. This impressive 222 m² home has been designed for those seeking perfection in every detail. Upon entering, you will be greeted by a spacious 75 m² living-dining room, a diaphanous and bright space that invites coexistence and enjoyment. The carefully installed herringbone floors add a touch of warmth and sophistication to every corner, while the strategically located LED lighting enhances the beauty of every architectural detail, creating a cozy and modern atmosphere. The independent kitchen, equipped with the most advanced appliances and top quality finishes, becomes a functional and elegant space, ideal for those who enjoy the culinary art. The three en-suite bedrooms, each with its own private bathroom, offer a haven of tranquility and privacy. The large built-in wardrobes are designed to meet all your storage needs, without compromising on style. In addition, each room has direct access to the terraces, allowing you to enjoy the outdoors and privileged views from the comfort of your bedroom. The two private terraces are the perfect complement to this unique home, offering an outdoor space to relax, entertain or simply enjoy a morning coffee with panoramic views. This home is not just a residence, it is a statement of style and good taste. Every detail has been thought out to provide an unparalleled living experience. If you are looking for a place where elegance meets functionality, this home is the perfect choice. Don't miss this unique opportunity. Your new dream home awaits you. Property Distribution and Details: • Living-Dining Room: Spacious and bright, with direct access to a spectacular terrace that offers panoramic views of the city. The NOVOFLOOR laminate flooring in casual herringbone MODE 34 adds a touch of elegance and warmth to the space. • Kitchen: Fully equipped with furniture from the prestigious brand 'Porcelanosa' in Mouse Mate color and 4 cm XTONE porcelain Liem Dark countertop. Latest generation Bosch appliances: Combi refrigerator, induction hob with integrated extractor, stainless steel oven, microwave, integrated dishwasher, washing machine and dryer. • Bedrooms: Three large bedrooms with built-in wardrobes. The master bedroom has an exclusive design dressing room. • Bathrooms: Three luxury bathrooms with high-end wall tiles. The master bathroom stands out for its polished MARSHAL Gold porcelain walls and floor, while the other two bathrooms feature Calacatta and Varana Marengo finishes, respectively. • Air Conditioning: Ducted air conditioning throughout the house, guaranteeing maximum comfort throughout the year. • Windows: White CORTIZO aluminum with thermal bridge break (RPT) and double hermetic glazing (DVH), motorized white aluminum slat blinds, ensuring thermal and acoustic insulation. • Lighting: 10x10 cm white Vinci recessed spotlights, providing elegant and uniform lighting throughout the house. Additional features: • Terrace: Arles 60x120 cm flooring, ideal for enjoying moments of relaxation outdoors. • Security: Motorized blind system and high security enclosures. • Location: Located in a privileged area, with access to the main communication routes, public transport, shopping centers, restaurants and entertainment venues. Call us, in less than 2 hours we organize a visit!

Treat yourself to reading about this extraordinary house. Magic lives here. At the gates of the Teatro Real, the silences of light and sun welcome you. You will hardly find 198 meters of classical harmony and serene design in perfect condition. The moldings and rosettes of the very high ceilings (3.5m) from the end of the 19th century sound like a piano throughout the house. The 3 balconies illuminate the infinite living room. The natural beveled oak of the floor (pieces of 3m x 30cms) provides warmth meter by meter. Every detail is sublime. Look at the height of the baseboards (25 cms) The incredible doors of 2.40 m high, contemporary versus modern. The very large dining room connected to the living room next to the exquisite high-end Italian design kitchen with countertops made of a single piece. Have you ever seen a hexagonal master bedroom? Of course with en suite bathroom. Or some restored silver cabinets converted into wardrobes. It is worth taking a close look at the original flooring of this room; a true work of art masterfully restored. Speechless. In addition, next to the bedroom you also have an original dressing room. And a large shoe rack. The second bathroom is also a work of art in itself. With two large windows, two sinks, a very large shower and also a large separate bathtub. At the end of the majestic corridor are the other two large and bright rooms. Isolated from the rest of the house to favor privacy. More details that surely interest you: the old adapted cast iron radiators with the original legs and cranks. The air conditioning installation is individualized in all rooms. PVC kommerling with thermal and acoustic bridge break tilt-and-turn windows throughout the house. As if all this were not enough, the house has a 55-meter attic with a skylight as a storage room on the top floor. A step away from the Teatro Real, the Royal Palace, the Almudena Cathedral and in the area of the new Great Luxury of Madrid Centro.

Welcome to the home of your dreams in the heart of Madrid! We present this magnificent semi-detached villa located in a prestigious urbanization in Quinta de los Molinos, a real estate jewel that combines luxury, comfort and a privileged location. With an area of 367 square meters distributed over 4 floors, this residence offers a unique lifestyle for those who value space and quality. Upon entering the ground floor, you will be greeted by an elegant hall that connects each space with harmony. A large kitchen with a clothesline area, a living room flooded with natural light, a courtesy toilet and an impressive living/dining room with direct access to a generous private terrace, ideal for enjoying the outdoors and the lush gardens and the refreshing community pool. A paradise for families with children and lovers of good living! The first floor offers three spacious exterior bedrooms, each with its own full bathroom, two of them en suite to provide privacy and comfort. On the second floor, a versatile open space with access to a large terrace/solarium offers endless possibilities according to personal needs and tastes. The basement surprises with the luminosity present in every corner. Here we find an additional room, a large living room perfect for family gatherings or with friends, a practical pantry, a cellar for wine lovers, an additional bathroom and a generous space with multiple options for use. In addition, it has a space for a garage with capacity for 3 vehicles, for total comfort. Experience the exclusivity of this gated community, designed for the well-being and security of its residents, and discover the magic of living in one of the most desirable areas of Madrid, with a wide range of services, shops and public transport. Here and now you have the opportunity to make this spectacular villa your home. Contact us to arrange a visit and see the residence of your dreams in Madrid!

2 parking spaces included in the price. Célere Bifaz is located in the new urban development of Los Berrocales, located in the southeast of Madrid, between Ensanche de Vallecas and Santa Eugenia. Its distance to the center of Madrid is 12 kilometers and 19 kilometers to the Madrid-Barajas Airport. It is perfectly connected by road by the M-50 to the east, A3 to the south, M-45 to the west and by the H-8 road that connects Berrocales with the Ensanche de Vallecas, connecting both neighborhoods, which will facilitate access to the Shopping Center, schools, health center, sports center, metro line 1 and urban bus lines, 142, 145, 103, N-9 (night bus). Célere Bifaz is a new residential project with an innovative design and a modern image. This development will create a new vision of the Berrocales neighborhood, as it is a 20-story tower. The development will have 87 homes with 1, 2 and 3 bedrooms distributed in two portals, as well as a commercial premises. All homes have a terrace, storage room and parking space, some homes have two spaces. The delivery date is scheduled for the second quarter of 2027. The project has a nice swimming pool for adults and another for children, a toilet area and an outdoor bicycle parking area. Wi-Fi will be available in the common areas. In order to enjoy the views, both the social-gourmet room and the gym have been located on the top floor of the building. In addition, the project has included an outdoor play area for children, where they can enjoy playing in a protected environment, and it also has a garden area. And as we always think about your safety, the urbanization is private, closed with access control and concierge. At Vía Célere we are committed to innovating and implementing increasingly efficient systems, achieving more sustainable buildings that are committed to the environment. The residential has an energy rating A, which represents an estimated energy saving of 83% reducing CO2 emissions and a significant reduction in the energy demand of the complex (cooling and domestic hot water). This qualification translates into an economic saving equivalent to about €1,500 per year, taking as a reference a home with energy rating F. *The images of the promotion are indicative and not definitive. The homes previously identified and their economic and commercial conditions are subject to availability and variations for administrative or commercial reasons. Check with the sales office.

Immerse yourself in the opportunity to reside in a modern and sustainable building, surrounded by green areas without having to leave Madrid. VÍA ÁGORA Peñagrande is a residential complex designed to provide comfort for both you and your loved ones. Consisting of 1, 2, 3 and 4 bedroom homes, with large terraces, ground floors with garden and penthouses so you can enjoy and relax outdoors. This project offers modern and functional common spaces, including: •Swimming pool •Ágora Club: a fully equipped gourmet space for coexistence and coworking. •Mini golf. In addition, it has the Allergy Friendly certification, which implements measures to improve the quality of life of residents with respiratory allergies. This approach shows sensitivity and attention to those who suffer from allergies, demonstrating our social commitment. All homes include a garage and storage room. Now you have the opportunity to live in a privileged location, close to a natural environment, a few minutes from the center of Madrid and all the services and possibilities that the city offers. Joaquín Lorenzo street is located in a consolidated and quiet area of Peñagrande, between Puerta de Hierro and Mirasierra. It is perfectly connected thanks to several main roads and close to health, sports and leisure centers. It is a unique enclave due to its location, its quiet atmosphere and its easy access to the main arteries of the capital and ring roads.

Unique opportunity: One of the few available houses in Recoletos with views of El Retiro park. Exclusive luxury home in one of the best areas of Madrid, located in the emblematic Calle Alcalá, semi-corner with Calle Velázquez, within the prestigious Barrio de Recoletos, in the district of Salamanca overlooking the Retiro park. This exterior flat, recently renovated with the highest qualities, has an area of 242 m² distributed in a spacious and bright living room with spectacular views of the Retiro Park. It has three bedrooms with en suite bathrooms, a guest toilet, a service bedroom and a fully equipped kitchen with high-end appliances. Main features: •Living room with unique views of the Retiro Park •3 bedrooms with en suite bathrooms •Service bedroom with its own bathroom •Toilet •Fully equipped kitchen with high-end appliances •Luxury renovation, brand new •Building on the third exterior floor •Privileged location in the Barrio de Salamanca Do not hesitate to contact us without obligation to receive more details. One of our sales representatives will be happy to answer all your questions and provide you with the information you need to make the best decision. Do you have any property to offer us? We are buying! We collaborate with intermediaries in off-market opportunities. We are looking for buildings and flats to renovate in prime locations. If you have any opportunity that you would like to share, please contact us. About Jh Arguello & Co Jh Arguello & Co is a group of companies specialized in the development of real estate projects. With a long history in the premium market, we offer a personalized and quality service for those who seek the highest level in their real estate investments. In addition, we are actively buying properties in the best areas of Madrid.

Ideal for couples, this exceptional 102m2 home with an impressive 55m2 terrace offers a cozy and elegant atmosphere. Located in the Colonia del Niño Jesús, a few meters from the beautiful Retiro Park, this property perfectly combines the comfort of urban life with the tranquility of a natural environment. The kitchen incorporated into the living room has a magnificent one-piece marble countertop, adding a touch of luxury to everyday life. The luminosity and warmth of the space are complemented by a cozy fireplace, creating the perfect setting for unforgettable moments. With one bedroom, one exterior bathroom and one toilet, this second floor without elevator offers a unique lifestyle in a building that was formerly a single classic-style home. Surrounded by all services and a few minutes from metro and bus lines, this property is ideal for couples looking for a charming home in a privileged location.

This magnificent three-bedroom apartment offers a perfect combination of elegance, comfort, and modernity. Every corner of this property has been designed with comfort and style in mind, making it an excellent opportunity for both investors and those looking for a cozy home in the heart of the city. Upon entering this charming apartment, you are welcomed by a bright living room that stands as the heart of the home. The modern decoration and carefully selected details create a cozy and sophisticated atmosphere. The white walls provide a sense of spaciousness and freshness, while the floating shelves add a contemporary and practical touch to display books and decorations. The fully equipped kitchen is a functional and well-used space. The ergonomic design makes cooking a pleasurable experience. In addition, it has a window that allows natural light to enter, creating a bright and airy atmosphere. The three bedrooms are spacious and well-lit, each with its own personality and style. The master bedroom stands out for its large built-in wooden wardrobe, which offers ample storage space, and for the warm and elegant decoration that invites relaxation. A stroll through the borough of Salamanca will reveal the most stylish and sought after buildings in the capital: historic buildings with stately halls, spacious interiors and high ceilings. Designed in the late nineteenth century by José de Salamanca y Mayol, Marquis of Salamanca, this district preserves its aristocratic atmosphere, as seen in the many mansions, such as the Italian Embassy, for example. This epicentre of luxury includes the acclaimed "Golden Mile": a shopping area with establishments of the most prestigious brands, such as Dior, Chanel, Prada or Tiffany and Promora. Shops, such as Gallery, BD or Vitra and restaurants, such as Ramsés or No, cater for those who prefer a modern and sophisticated lifestyle. This is a lively and safe area, with wide pavements, almost unlimited parking spaces and an interesting nightlife: Nxt Club, Déjate Besar or Le Boutique Club. There are also art galleries and cultural centres, such as the March Foundation and the Lázaro Galdiano Museum. The area is noted for its luxurious trees and the proximity of the Retiro Park, the city centre's largest green space.

Every borough in Madrid has its own story, its charm. In the case of the borough of Palacio, we have an area with streets that have witnessed the entire history of the city; from the middle ages, when Madrid was only a fortress, to the pre-baroque, when Philip II made it the capital of the Kingdom, to the arrival of the Bourbons in the eighteenth century or its expansion in the twentieth century, which can be seen in the final section of the Gran Via. Indeed, the borough of Palacio provides a glimpse into the history of Madrid. All Spain's monarchs have left their mark here. Even Joseph Bonaparte, who conceived the current Oriente Square, left his mark.  This is a very pleasant place to live, particularly since the pedestrianisation of the area around the Royal Palace, the Almudena Cathedral and Oriente Square and, more recently, Arenal and Mayor streets. However, in addition to the large and peaceful gardens, we have the lively and dynamic nature of Madrid. That "rogue" Madrid, full of typical bars, outstanding restaurants or gastronomic centres, such as the San Miguel Market. There is something in Palacio that defines it as a borough: a perfect balance between a quiet life and the liveliness of a great European metropolis.

Every borough in Madrid has its own story, its charm. In the case of the borough of Palacio, we have an area with streets that have witnessed the entire history of the city; from the middle ages, when Madrid was only a fortress, to the pre-baroque, when Philip II made it the capital of the Kingdom, to the arrival of the Bourbons in the eighteenth century or its expansion in the twentieth century, which can be seen in the final section of the Gran Via. Indeed, the borough of Palacio provides a glimpse into the history of Madrid. All Spain's monarchs have left their mark here. Even Joseph Bonaparte, who conceived the current Oriente Square, left his mark.  This is a very pleasant place to live, particularly since the pedestrianisation of the area around the Royal Palace, the Almudena Cathedral and Oriente Square and, more recently, Arenal and Mayor streets. However, in addition to the large and peaceful gardens, we have the lively and dynamic nature of Madrid. That "rogue" Madrid, full of typical bars, outstanding restaurants or gastronomic centres, such as the San Miguel Market. There is something in Palacio that defines it as a borough: a perfect balance between a quiet life and the liveliness of a great European metropolis.

The locals say Chamberí is one of the most traditional boroughs in Madrid. There is truth in that statement, but it is also one of the most elegant. A walk along its streets is an opportunity to enjoy beautiful tree-line pavements, charming squares, such as Olavide, and emblematic buildings like the Hospital de Maudes, the Casa de la Flores or the mansions in the well-known "Golden Triangle": an area where much of Madrid's aristocracy settled in the late nineteenth and early twentieth centuries and that extends from Paseo de la Castellana to the streets of Génova, Almagro and Miguel Ángel. This is an open borough where sophisticated restaurants (Sergi Arola Gastro, La Caña or Atelier Belge) mix with popular taverns. This is a neighbourhood of art galleries (Astarté, Elvira González, Marlborough), exhibition centres, such as the one belonging to Canal de Isabel II (built inside a huge water tank), or museums, such as the Sorolla Museum or the former Chamberí Metro Station. We must not forget to mention the nightlife and clubs. Just to name a few establishments: the mythical Sala Clamores, the Moma Fifty Six or the classic Club Fortuny.

It is also noted for the various lifestyles that coexist as well as the large avenues, residential areas, official buildings, ministries, embassies, museums, auditoriums, etc. The district is divided into six wards with distinctive characteristics, from the most exclusive luxury residential areas, such as El Viso or Nueva España, to typical neighbourhood configurations such as Prosperidad or Ciudad Jardín. In short, Chamartín is an ideal district for people who demand quality housing together with a wide range of services, shops, schools, sports facilities, hotels, gastronomy and leisure activities, hospitals, clinics and an extensive public transport network. Madrid, which has all kinds of services and equipment for people who reside in that area, being a neighborhood with high purchasing power.The Almagro neighborhood, in its best area, stands out in the Madrid total and is comparable to the best and most expensive areas of the Salamanca neighborhood (neighborhood with the greatest impact?/m²).Almagro was conceived as an exclusive area of Madrid, being part of the first urban plan carried out in the capital.It was designed in two areas: the noble area, where the mansions near Castellana are and the bourgeois area, located by Santa Engracia.Numerous palaces, embassies, art galleries and cultural centers make up this elegant axis of the capital.Very cozy and quiet area where some of the best-known hospitality establishments in Madrid are located.The area has a great educational offer, with charter and private schools.It is also a very charming area for shopping, highlighting its proximity to the Fuencarral axis.One of the most spectacular places in the neighborhood is the Sorolla Museum.The buildings that surround you in this magical neighborhood have many stories to tell.The House of Flowers is one of them.It was home to the great Chilean poet Pablo Neruda while he lived in Madrid shortly before the Spanish Civil War.The neighborhood directs you towards Colón, the square where countless events are held and which houses the Fernán Gómez Theater.But in the heart of the neighborhood are hidden architectural gems such as the recently remodeled Frontón Beti-Jai, a key place to understand Madrid's social life at the end of the 19th and beginning of the 20th centuries.We are talking about a very open neighborhood where sophisticated restaurants (Sergi Arola Gastro, La Caña or Atelier Belge) mix without prejudice with popular taverns.

One-of-a-kind property in Conde Duque Engel & Völkers promotes spectacular property with very top design reform in Conde Duque, Madrid. Located in an impeccable emblematic building of the early twentieth century very well preserved and maintained by the community of neighbors under the certification of the City of Madrid. Conde Duque is a lively, bohemian and casual neighborhood, with an emerging and modern commerce but with a vintage air. Its apparent tranquility and calmness contrast with the bustle and fervent activity of the Gran Vía, the recently renovated Plaza de España and Princesa Street, which mark its limits to the south. The real name of the monumental building of Conde Duque, which imprints personality to the whole area, is the Royal Barracks of the Corps Guards, an elite corps that was dedicated to the custody of the monarchs. Its construction began in 1717 by order of Philip V, the first Bourbon king, who commissioned its design to the great Madrid architect Pedro de Ribera. Of its more than 200 meters of façade, its Churrigueresque style façade, carved in stone and located in front of the Plaza de Guardias de Corps, stands out.

The Salamanca district, built at the Salamanca Marquis's order at the end of the XIXth Century and on which he spent most of his fortune, is the prototype of urban development, an aristocratic neighbourhood with large avenues that drive traffic to the many shops and luxury brands available, as well as imposing palaces - the Sevillan writer Gustavo Adolfo Bécquer lived in one of them. A walk within the streets of this exclusive neighbourhood offers a pleasant sensation of entering an exclusive aristocratic world. Brands such as Loewe, Lubaloo, Prada, Valentino, Miu Miu, Cartier and many others delight the most wealthy residents of this neighbourhood called the Golden Mile. The maximum indicator of luxurious gastronomy is the Platea City Mall, full with restaurants such as Ramón Freixa or Sinergias, which resulted from the union of three of the most valuable Spanish chefs. They attract visitors with innovative recipes and enviable sweets of Mamá Framboise, among others. For all those who love traditional food, the Salamanca district is the best place to enjoy the most exquisite tapas of Madrid. The Casa Dani restaurant, located in the Mercado de la Paz, Qué tapas, in the Mercado de Torrijos or the Santa Barbara brewery offer the opportunity to taste octopus, Iberic ham, Spanish tortilla or patatas bravas. After all, this is a neighbourhood that very much resembles the wonderful Paris that identifies with luxury and glamour.

The Salamanca neighbourhood is one of the most important areas of Madrid, both for its peculiar distribution and for the residents who have traditionally inhabited its emblematic streets. Its construction dates back to the second half of the 19th century and corresponds to the urban expansion carried out during the reign of Isabel II. The precursor to whom it owes its name was the Malaga-born José de Salamanca y Mayol, Marquis of Salamanca, who conceived a new site with a carefully designed building that would house Madrid's aristocratic and bourgeois classes. regular layout in the form of a checkerboard with perpendicular streets. Its buildings are of special interest thanks to their architectural quality and the beauty of their façades. Salamanca was traditionally a residential area, especially inhabited by the country's political and economic elite.

Gilmar Consulting presents exclusively this 102 square meter bright apartment, distributed in an entrance hall, living room, separate kitchen, 3 bedrooms, and 2 bathrooms in one of the best locations in Parque de las Avenidas. The building is a stately property with a doorman. La Guindalera (also known as Barrio de Guindalera) is a neighborhood in Madrid belonging to the Salamanca district. It is located near Ventas del Espíritu Santo and is delimited by Avenida de América and the streets of Francisco Silvela, Alcalá, and M-30.  It began to be populated in the mid-19th century as a satellite neighborhood of the expansion of the Castro Plan, with horticultural settlements that took advantage of the "canalillo" (the surplus channel of the Canal de Isabel II). Later, it grew with the creation of the so-called Madrid Moderno and the Ciudad Lineal by Arturo Soria. The Breogán park, next to the M-30, and the Eva Duarte park in Manuel Becerra are located on the outskirts of the neighborhood. The etymology of the neighborhood's name may come from a popular cherry orchard irrigated by the nearby Abroñigal stream. The neighborhood had one of the first tram lines in Madrid. The closest stations are Nuevos Ministerios (C-1, C-2, C-3, C-4, C-7, C-8, and C-10, Chamartín district) and Méndez Álvaro (C-1, C-5, C-7, and C-10, Arganzuela district), which can be reached by metro line 6, and Recoletos (C-1, C-2, C-7, C-8, and C-10, Recoletos neighborhood), which can be reached by metro line 4. The neighborhood is served by metro lines 2, 4, 5, 6, 7, and 9. • Line 2 serves the southern part of the neighborhood with the Manuel Becerra and Ventas stations. • Line 4 serves the Francisco Silvela axis, stopping at Diego de León and Avenida de América. • Line 5 crosses the neighborhood from the south, stopping at Diego de León and Ventas. • Line 6 runs parallel to Line 4, also going through Avenida de América and Diego de León, and stopping separately at Manuel Becerra. • Line 7 serves the northern and eastern parts of the neighborhood with the Avenida de América, Cartagena, and Parque de las Avenidas stations. • Line 9 serves only the northwestern end of the neighborhood with the Avenida de América station. A large number of bus lines run through the neighborhood, including lines 1, 53, 74, 43, and 48.

Also for being the link between the Sabatini Gardens, the Campo del Moro, the Casa de Campo and Madrid Rio. After a profound transformation, it is, with its 70,000 m2, one of the new central axes of the city, a green space -it has 1,110 trees with sculptures, children's playgrounds and cycle paths. During the works to transform the square, the remains of the walkway of the old Cuartel de San Gil, the stables of the Royal Palace and the former Palace of Godoy, Carlos IV's favorite and prime minister, all designed by the architect Francesco Sabatini, author of the Puerta de Alcalá, were uncovered. The Plaza de España is a fantastic starting point for exploring the surrounding area, from the Palacio de Liria or the Cerralbo Museum, just a few steps away, to the Parque del Oeste and the Temple of Debod.

The Salamanca district, built by the Marquis of Salamanca at the end of the 19th century and on which he spent practically his entire fortune, is the prototype of the urban expansion, of the garden city, of the aristocratic district with large avenues around which luxury shops and businesses are built, and grandiose palaces, one of which was the home of the Sevillian writer Gustavo Adolfo Bécquer. Strolling through the streets of this exclusive neighbourhood, one has the sensation of entering a world destined exclusively for the aristocracy. Brands such as Loewe, Lubaloo, the leader of children's fashion, Prada, Valentino, Miu Miu, Cartier and so many others that delight the most fortunate pockets are to be found on the Golden Mile. The ultimate expression of luxury, as far as restaurants are concerned, is the recently inaugurated Platea Leisure Centre, a unique space with restaurants such as Ramón Freixa's or Sinergias, the result of the union of three of the best Spanish chefs with renewed recipes and the most coveted sweets from Mamá Framboise, among many other delicacies. For anyone who comes from out of town and is a lover of traditional food, the Salamanca neighbourhood is the best place to enjoy the most exquisite tapas in Madrid. The restaurant-brewery Casa Dani, in the Mercado de la Paz, Qué tapas, in the Mercado de Torrijos, or the Cervecería Santa Bárbara, are some of the examples where you can enjoy delicious portions of octopus, Serrano ham, omelette or patatas bravas. In short, a neighbourhood built in the image and likeness of the marvellous Paris where luxury and glamour are the main protagonists.

The Salamanca neighborhood is one of the most important areas of Madrid, both for its peculiar distribution and for the neighbors who have traditionally inhabited its emblematic streets.  Its construction dates from the second half of the 19th century and corresponds to the urban expansion carried out during the reign of Isabel II. The precursor to whom it owes its name was the Malaga-born José de Salamanca y Mayol, Marquis of Salamanca, who conceived a new site with a careful construction that would house the aristocratic and bourgeois classes of Madrid.  Of nineteenth-century style, it is characterized by its special regular distribution in the form of a checkerboard with perpendicular streets. Its buildings are of special interest thanks to their architectural quality and the beauty of their facades.

The District of Argüelles, was born in the period of the Ensanche, and is a magnificent exponent of bourgeois Madrid. Limited by the Parque de la Montaña and Calle Princesa, it advances in a narrow strip from the Plaza de España and towards the Parque del Oeste, delimited by the streets of Pintor Rosales, Irún, Paseo Moret, Ferraz, Princesa, the Plaza de España and the Cuesta de San Vicente. In its streets there are palaces such as the "Infanta Isabel de Borbón" and old asylums and convents, such "The Buen Suceso". It is an ideal place to live, given its quite central location, its green surroundings in front of the Parque del Oeste and the Parque de la Montaña (where the Egyptian temple of Debod is located), and the presence of numerous shops, leisure areas, bars and restaurants with their attractive terraces. In its streets we can find plenty of the most important cinemas in original versión of the city, as well as having a look to a few important figures of Spanish celluloid in his particular Walk of the Fame. One of the most unique areas of the capital for its variety and great infrastructure with six schools, several schools for early childhood education, one clinic, one specialties center and its wide variety of Supermarkets and Restaurants. At the same time, the neighbors of this charming neighborhood enjoy the wonderful Parque del Oeste, considered one of the lungs of Madrid. This district has excellent communications thanks to its proximity the M-30, the A-6, Carretera de Castilla and the Moncloa Interchange: with direct access to the Sierra de Madrid, and the access to the downtown area of the capital. The Salamanca neighborhood is one of the most appreciated residential and commercial areas of Madrid, and with the highest standard of living in all of Europe. The neighborhood takes its name from José de Salamanca y Mayol, the Marquis of Salamanca, who promoted and directed its construction in the mid-19th century, carried out during the reign of Isabel II. It was built for the aristocratic and bourgeois classes, with large avenues in a regular distribution in the shape of a checkerboard with perpendicular streets, around which luxury shops and businesses are organized, and grandiose palaces, in one of which the Sevillian writer Gustavo lived. Adolfo Becquer. Currently, we are talking about a dynamic and safe area, with large sidewalks, with an interesting life, thanks to the fact that it is the epicenter of the capital's luxury shops, also known for the “Golden Mile”, where the most prestigious firms in the world. It also concentrates a high number of Embassies in nineteenth-century buildings with great architectural value. And we find the most cosmopolitan hospitality establishments in the capital, such as the famous “Platea Madrid” which is the largest gastronomic leisure center in Europe. The proximity to Retiro Park gives it the label of being one of the best neighborhoods to live in Madrid. The Salamanca neighborhood is one of the most appreciated residential and commercial areas of Madrid, and with the highest standard of living in all of Europe. The neighborhood takes its name from José de Salamanca y Mayol, the Marquis of Salamanca, who promoted and directed its construction in the mid-19th century, carried out during the reign of Isabel II. It was built for the aristocratic and bourgeois classes, with large avenues in a regular distribution in the shape of a checkerboard with perpendicular streets, around which luxury shops and businesses are organized, and grandiose mansions, in one of which the Sevillian writer Gustavo lived. Adolfo Becquer. The district of Salamanca, ordered to be built by the Marquis of Salamanca at the end of the 19th century and where he spent practically all his fortune, is the prototype of urban expansion, of a garden city, of an aristocratic district with large avenues around which there are luxury shops and businesses, and grandiose mansions, in one of which the Sevillian writer Gustavo Adolfo Bécquer lived. Walking through the streets of this exclusive neighbourhood gives the sensation of entering a world destined exclusively for the aristocracy. Firms such as Loewe, Lubaloo, a champion of children's fashion, Prada, Valentino, Miu Miu, Cartier and so many others that delight the most fortunate pockets come together on the Golden Mile. The maximum expression of luxury, as far as restaurants are concerned, corresponds to the recently inaugurated Centro de Ocio Platea, a unique space with restaurants such as Ramón Freixa's or Sinergias, born from the union of three of the best Spanish chefs with renewed recipes and the most coveted sweets from Mamá Framboise, among other delights. For anyone who comes from abroad and is a lover of traditional food, the Salamanca district is the best place to enjoy the most exquisite tapas in Madrid. The restaurant-brewery Casa Dani, in the Mercado de la Paz, Qué tapas, in the Mercado de Torrijos, or the Cervecería Santa Bárbara, are some of the examples where you can taste delicious portions of octopus, cured ham, tortilla or patatas bravas. In short, a district built in the image and likeness of the wonderful Paris in which luxury and glamour are the main protagonists.

The Salamanca neighborhood is one of the most important areas of Madrid, both for its peculiar distribution and for the neighbors who have traditionally inhabited its emblematic streets.  Its construction dates from the second half of the 19th century and corresponds to the urban expansion carried out during the reign of Isabel II. The precursor to whom it owes its name was the Malaga-born José de Salamanca y Mayol, Marquis of Salamanca, who conceived a new site with a careful construction that would house the aristocratic and bourgeois classes of Madrid.  Of nineteenth-century style, it is characterized by its special regular distribution in the form of a checkerboard with perpendicular streets. Its buildings are of special interest thanks to their architectural quality and the beauty of their facades. Traditionally Salamanca was a residential area, especially inhabited by the political and economic elites of the country. In the last fifty years this residential character coexists with other activities such as business, diplomatic and especially commercial, as it is one of the most important luxury fashion areas of the capital.

The Argüelles neighbourhood was born in the Ensanche period, and is a magnificent example of bourgeois Madrid. It is an ideal place to live, given its fairly central location, its green surroundings opposite the  Parque del Oeste and Parque de la Montaña (where the Egyptian temple of Debod is located), and the presence of numerous shops, leisure areas, bars and restaurants with their attractive terraces. Its streets are home to the largest number of original version cinemas in the city. It is one of the most unique areas of the capital because of its variety and excellent infrastructure with six schools, several nursery schools, an outpatient clinic, a speciality centre and a wide variety of supermarkets and restaurants. The Salamanca neighborhood is one of the most appreciated residential and commercial areas of Madrid, and with the highest standard of living in all of Europe. The neighborhood takes its name from José de Salamanca y Mayol, the Marquis of Salamanca, who promoted and directed its construction in the mid-19th century, carried out during the reign of Isabel II. It was built for the aristocratic and bourgeois classes, with large avenues in a regular distribution in the shape of a checkerboard with perpendicular streets, around which luxury shops and businesses are organized, and grandiose palaces, in one of which the Sevillian writer Gustavo lived. Adolfo Becquer. Currently, we are talking about a dynamic and safe area, with large sidewalks, with an interesting life, thanks to the fact that it is the epicenter of the capital's luxury shops, also known for the “Golden Mile”, where the most prestigious firms in the world. It also concentrates a high number of Embassies in nineteenth-century buildings with great architectural value. And we find the most cosmopolitan hospitality establishments in the capital, such as the famous “Platea Madrid” which is the largest gastronomic leisure center in Europe. The proximity to Retiro Park gives it the label of being one of the best neighborhoods to live in Madrid. The Salamanca neighborhood is one of the most appreciated residential and commercial areas of Madrid, and with the highest standard of living in all of Europe. The neighborhood takes its name from José de Salamanca y Mayol, the Marquis of Salamanca, who promoted and directed its construction in the mid-19th century, carried out during the reign of Isabel II. It was built for the aristocratic and bourgeois classes, with large avenues in a regular distribution in the shape of a checkerboard with perpendicular streets, around which luxury shops and businesses are organized, and grandiose palaces, in one of which the Sevillian writer Gustavo lived. Adolfo Becquer. Currently, we are talking about a dynamic and safe area, with large sidewalks, with an interesting life, thanks to the fact that it is the epicenter of the capital's luxury shops, also known for the “Golden Mile”, where the most prestigious firms in the world. It also concentrates a high number of Embassies in nineteenth-century buildings with great architectural value. And we find the most cosmopolitan hospitality establishments in the capital, such as the famous “Platea Madrid” which is the largest gastronomic leisure center in Europe. The proximity to Retiro Park gives it the label of being one of the best neighborhoods to live in Madrid. Extraordinary building on Nuestra Señora de los Dolores street, number 18, almost on the corner with Capitán Blanco Argibay street, very well connected by metro and buses. Located in a neighborhood in the middle of a residential urban transformation, it will enjoy qualities far superior to the usual ones. It will be an exclusive complex of 9 one-bedroom homes (including 2 penthouses with terraces), which will enjoy the energy certification A, thanks to the materials used for its construction and its air conditioning system, through underfloor heating/cooling with individual control per room. The production for heating, air conditioning and DHW will be carried out through a centralized aerothermal system, with individual meters. With impeccable aesthetics, the exterior façade will be ventilated in a porcelain finish and the interior in SATE finished in acrylic mortar. The urbanization is completely closed and has a security system through surveillance cameras installed in the common areas. Among the latter are a large low-consumption garden area with automatic irrigation with an outdoor adult pool with saline chlorination and automatic Ph regulator with solarium. In addition, there is a community room equipped with a very well-lit cold kitchen towards the interior and the entrance to the garage. The PVC carpentry will be of the highest quality, with motorized blinds with the option of automating through an optional home automation system that includes the pre-installation. The homes are also delivered with a Securitas alarm installed (with 6 months free). The kitchens are fully furnished and equipped with all appliances. All homes include a storage room. There are 6 optional parking spaces available. * The images are indicative and not contractual.

Immerse yourself in an unparalleled experience with the 50 smart apartments of Eurogreen Smart, a visionary project that redefines the contemporary lifestyle. Designed by the renowned architecture studio Martin De la Fuente, this emblematic enclave fuses architectural innovation with natural beauty. Each apartment offers an elegant design with curved and rectangular lines, reflecting deconstructivism and minimalism with touches of cubism. Enjoy 1 and 2 bedroom residential units, large terraces and green areas, as well as private pools on the upper and lower floors. With a ground floor equipped with a coworking area, garden and communal pool, Eurogreen Smart promotes relaxation and well-being. In addition, our exclusive private rooftop offers panoramic views of the mountains and the surrounding nature, complemented by a 25-meter heated infinity pool, gym, full spa and a wide range of concierge and personal care services. Join our loyalty club to access exclusive benefits and enjoy a carefree life at Eurogreen Smart, where your comfort and well-being are our top priority! Eurogreen Smart: Design and Quality in Every Detail Facade: Porcelain stoneware cladding on a brick facade with thermal insulation, highlighting terrace parapets in white "KRION" prefabricated panels. Roofs: Configured as non-passable and passable, waterproofed and thermally and acoustically insulated. Partitioning and Insulation: "Pladur" system with double 13mm plate and semi-rigid mineral rock wool panel insulation. Coatings and False Ceilings: Bathroom walls in marble, ceramic mosaic, porcelain stoneware and imitation stucco paint, ceilings with perimeter moat and Bandalux brand blinds with Somfy motor. Furniture and Kitchen Installations: Gunni & Trentino brand kitchen furniture, Silestone Eternal Calacatta Gold Suede countertop, stainless steel Clip hinges, and complete equipment with high-end appliances. Installation of Air Conditioning and ACS: Centralized aerothermal energy, Uponor brand underfloor heating, Daikin brand individual heat pump. Domotics, Electricity and Telecommunications Installations: SISTEMA FREE@HOME ABB home automation system, Simon 100 electrical mechanisms, installation according to REBT and complementary ICT regulations. Active and Passive Security Measures: Gated community, access control, and generator to ensure electrical supply in case of emergency. Common Areas: Main lobby, full spa, equipped gym, playroom, indoor and outdoor pools, terraces with panoramic views, among others. Basement and Garages: Epoxy resin pavement, microchina terrazzo, automatic door, charging station for electric vehicles, among others. Date 21 is an exclusive new development promotion located in Puerta Bonita, Carabanchel, offering a unique opportunity to acquire a home with a terrace in one of the quietest and best connected areas of Madrid. Located on Calle Date 21, a few steps from Calle Eugenia de Montijo and Avenida de los Poblados, this development is located in one of the most valued neighborhoods for those looking for new construction flats in Madrid, with excellent transport connections. 1 and 2 bedroom apartments with optimal communication With only 9 homes of 1 and 2 bedrooms, including studios, Date 21 has been designed to guarantee maximum comfort. Its location is ideal, with nearby metro stations such as San Francisco and Carabanchel Alto just a 10-minute walk away. In addition, several bus lines such as 47, 121 and 131 are within reach, facilitating mobility throughout the city. Easy access by car and the proximity to Eugenia de Montijo add an advantage for those who prefer to travel in their own vehicle. Sustainability and energy efficiency Date 21 stands out for its focus on sustainability, offering homes with an energy rating A, an aerothermal system for air conditioning and domestic hot water, and refreshing underfloor heating, which ensures significant energy savings. In addition, it has PVC carpentry that guarantees excellent thermal and acoustic insulation, providing maximum comfort inside each home. Green and balanced environment Located in a natural environment, Date 21 combines urban life with the tranquility of green areas. Its surroundings are adorned with trees, grass and meadows, creating a cozy atmosphere ideal for outdoor enjoyment. The nearby green areas offer the opportunity to walk or play sports in a healthy and relaxing environment. Main characteristics of the promotion: -1 and 2 bedroom homes, all with private terrace. -Views of green areas in a quiet environment. -Energy rating A for greater efficiency. -Photovoltaic and aerothermal energy systems. -Refreshing underfloor heating for summer comfort and energy saving. -High quality PVC carpentry for better insulation. -Option to customize the home to suit your tastes and needs. Close to all essential services Nearby educational centers and schools. Parks and green areas to enjoy outdoors. Supermarkets, restaurants and leisure options in the immediate vicinity. Health centers and pharmacies a few minutes away. Easy access to several bus and metro lines, connecting with the rest of Madrid. Do not miss the opportunity to live in Date 21, a development that combines design, sustainability and a privileged location in the heart of Carabanchel.

Undoubtedly a great opportunity to live in a great and singular home near the area of the great museums, Paseo del Prado, El Retiro Park and Botanical Garden. Located in the Cortes neighborhood, its official name is due to the fact that within this neighborhood is located the Congreso de los Diputados, the lower chamber of the Cortes Generales of Spain. The nickname, more popular among the population, is due to the "Huertas del Prado" that were in the seventeenth century in the current Paseo del Prado, which is part of the World Heritage of UNESCO and also give name to the main street of the neighborhood: Calle de las Huertas, very close to the Plaza Neptuno and Plaza Platería Martínez. The location of the property is excellent, not only because it is in the center of Madrid, next to the major museums, but also because it is within the circuit with the most gastronomic and service offer of the city. One of the must-see areas in Madrid to enjoy the atmosphere offered by the city. In the area are located the Prado and Thyssen-Bornemisza museums and nearby is the Reina Sofia Art Center, promoted for tourism under the name of Paseo or Art Triangle. It is surrounded by green areas such as the Botanical Garden, and very close to the Retiro Park, which makes it perfect for those who want to live in the center of Madrid but without leaving aside the contact with nature. It is also located in the new luxury area of Centro Canalejas, Four Seasons and JW Marriott. It is the symbolic neighborhood where tradition and vanguard merge, the cultural focus of the city. The level of infrastructure and services in the area is excellent. It is very well served by public transportation. It has a wide range of small fashionable places: restaurants, bars, cafes, bookstores, stores, art galleries and coworking workshops. Schools, cinemas, theaters and entertainment venues can also be found in the area.

Within immediate reach, you can immerse yourself in Madrid's iconic sites like the Royal Palace, Almudena Cathedral, the charming terraces of Plaza de Oriente and Plaza de Ramales, stunning sunsets at Vistillas, and the city's highest concentration of lush green spaces including Campo del Moro, Sabatini Gardens, Parque de Atenas, Temple of Debod Gardens, and Madrid Río. The meticulously restored historic building from 1834, encompassing a recent renovation from its foundations to its roof, retains its original charm while incorporating modern comforts. Noteworthy for being one of the few 19th-century buildings in Madrid with an integrated elevator within the original wooden staircase. FEATURES AND LAYOUT: The interior showcases intelligent design, seamlessly integrating the kitchen, living room, and bedroom into a bright and spacious environment. The kitchen stands out with a floor level difference and an entrance framed by restored brickwork, pillars, and original wooden beams, while the living room can be separated from the bedroom by a wooden island fixture on the microcement floor, creating distinct zones without compromising the sense of openness. The apartment boasts top-quality amenities and technologies from an alarm system and wifi connection to thermal and acoustic insulation, along with a range of meticulously illuminated and furnished floor-to-ceiling storage spaces. Specially designed indirect lighting, including perimeter floor-level luminaires, enhances the ambiance. Heating and cooling are seamlessly integrated under the floor through a modern and eco-friendly aerothermal system. The modern and functional kitchen features a central island housing induction cooktops, oven-microwave, refrigerator, and dishwasher from premier brands, all discreetly integrated and concealed to maintain a minimalist aesthetic. The living and relaxation areas have been thoughtfully renovated, respecting the building's history by preserving and restoring the original wooden pillars, beams, and frames. Custom-made climalit tilt-and-turn windows ensure optimal thermal and acoustic insulation while maximizing natural light entry. The bathroom exudes modern elegance, equipped with high-quality fixtures, a concealed washer-dryer, a shower with a screen, and a toilet in a partitioned enclosure. In summary, this property is an exceptional treasure in the heart of Madrid, seamlessly blending the rich historical backdrop with the modern comforts of a brand-new renovation to offer a truly distinctive living experience.

LOOKING FOR THE RIGHT HOUSE Probably the most difficult part of the home buying process is choosing the right home.For this it is necessary to carry out a careful search, and thus, COMPARE the different possibilities offered by the market. RECOGNIZE in detail the physical characteristics of the home. FIND OUT the legal status of the home. We can carry out the search for the home personally or go to a Real Estate Agent to carry out your search. In the latter case, the API will present us with different purchase possibilities that we choose, taking into account who is selling, Bank, Investment Fund, owner, a development company. IN ANY CASE, before signing any contract or disbursing any amount of money, we must: 1.Examine the physical characteristics of the home.To do this, it is essential to carry out a personal visit to the home offered for sale, going to see it, checking that it matches what is offered, the quality of its materials, the state of its facilities, its degree of conservation, luminosity, views., environment you enjoy, noise, access to means of transportation, etc.Do not hesitate to bring any anomaly to the attention of the agency staff that shows you the home, and if you are not convinced by their explanations, be accompanied by a professional (architect, quantity surveyor). two.Examine the legal situation of the home.To know well the home that we are going to acquire, it is not only necessary to visit it, but it is also essential to know what its legal situation is, that is, FIND OUT: * To whom it belongs, and therefore, who or who are its owners. * If there are charges or encumbrances on it, that is, if there are mortgages, embargoes or other charges that affect it. * If there are tenants or owners of it. * If it is subject to any special regime, as is the case with Officially Protected Housing. * In the case of an apartment in a community of owners, if you are up to date with the payment of community fees. * If the Real Estate Tax has been paid for it. * The Statutes of the community.They may contain limitations to the right of ownership, such as, for example, not being able to use a home for tourist rental, the obligation to bear or not bear certain expenses, being able to divide the home without authorization from the Board of Owners, etc. To find out such circumstances we must go to the PROPERTY REGISTRY in which the home is registered.We may request the information ourselves, or the seller, the real estate agent, or an administrative manager may request it for us. In any case, registration information must be requested before delivering any amount or signing any contract.

Designed in the late nineteenth century by José de Salamanca y Mayol, Marquis of Salamanca, this district preserves its aristocratic atmosphere, as seen in the many mansions, such as the Italian Embassy, for example. This epicentre of luxury includes the acclaimed "Golden Mile": a shopping area with establishments of the most prestigious brands, such as Dior, Chanel, Prada or Tiffany and Promora. Shops, such as Gallery, BD or Vitra and restaurants, such as Ramsés or No, cater for those who prefer a modern and sophisticated lifestyle. This is a lively and safe area, with wide pavements, almost unlimited parking spaces and an interesting nightlife: Nxt Club, Déjate Besar or Le Boutique Club. The locals say Chamberí is one of the most traditional boroughs in Madrid. There is truth in that statement, but it is also one of the most elegant. A walk along its streets is an opportunity to enjoy beautiful tree-line pavements, charming squares, such as Olavide, and emblematic buildings like the Hospital de Maudes, the Casa de la Flores or the mansions in the well-known "Golden Triangle": an area where much of Madrid's aristocracy settled in the late nineteenth and early twentieth centuries and that extends from Paseo de la Castellana to the streets of Génova, Almagro and Miguel Ángel. This is an open borough where sophisticated restaurants (Sergi Arola Gastro, La Caña or Atelier Belge) mix with popular taverns. This is a neighbourhood of art galleries (Astarté, Elvira González, Marlborough), exhibition centres, such as the one belonging to Canal de Isabel II (built inside a huge water tank), or museums, such as the Sorolla Museum or the former Chamberí Metro Station. We must not forget to mention the nightlife and clubs. Just to name a few establishments: the mythical Sala Clamores, the Moma Fifty Six or the classic Club Fortuny.

It is located in one of the quietest areas of Madrid, in the district of Moncloa-Aravaca, where it runs parallel to the Manzanares River, from the roundabout of San Vicente to the roundabout of San Antonio de la Florida, next to the twin hermitages of San Antonio de la Florida, on the banks of the Manzanares River. Roundabout where the Paseo de la Florida and Avenida de Valladolid converge. From the Príncipe Pío station you can reach the hermitages along the Paseo de la Florida. The neighboring Madrid Río park allows you to finish your journey crossing the Manzanares riverbed through the Reina bridge. Nearby are the rose garden of the Parque del Oeste and the Madrid cable car, which offers aerial views of the area. Numerous restaurants located in the old pavilions of the Feria del Campo and the kiosks around the lake. Walking or cycling, you can access the Casa de Campo through eleven gates: those of the Río or del Rey and that of Moreras to the east; those of Batán, Venta, Dante, Grande and Ángel to the south; and those of Aravaca, Somosaguas, Rodajos and Zarzón to the west, from where there is also an entrance through half a dozen gates. The bus lines that give access to the park are: to the south 25, 31, 33, 36, 39, 55 and 65; to the east 41 and 75; and to the north 160 and 161. By Metro you can get there by line 5 (Casa de Campo station) and by line 10 (Lago, Batán and Casa de Campo stations). Very well connected area and next to La Estación de Príncipe Pío, which is a transport interchange in Madrid where several metro lines, Cercanías, Media Distancia and urban and intercity buses converge, delimited by the Glorieta de San Vicente, Cuesta de San Vicente, Paseo de la Florida and the Paseo del Rey, in the district of Moncloa-Aravaca. This station is the terminus of lines C-1 and C-7. When a train from one of the lines finishes its journey, it passes to the other, so in reality lines C-1 and C-7 are the same for practical purposes. In addition, line C-10 stops, with the same route as the C-1 to the airport and that of the C-7 to Las Rozas. All the daytime urban and intercity lines that had their terminus at the old Príncipe Pío bus station, in front of the station building, in the Glorieta de San Vicente or in the Paseo de la Virgen del Puerto have been progressively incorporated into the interchange, together with some that had their terminus at the Madrid South Bus Station. The interregional lines operated by La Veloz, destination Talavera de la Reina (and region) that previously departed from the neighboring La Florida bus station, at number 11 Paseo de la Florida, also depart from here. There are several stops in the surroundings of the Glorieta through which different EMT Madrid bus lines pass and stop, an intercity line (of an urban nature) operated by Prisei and an intercity line with its terminus in Moncloa.

Puerta de Hierro is located in the northwest and is characterized by its vast green areas and parks. This environmental wealth and the tranquility that accompanies it have made the neighborhoods that make up the district a privileged enclave to live close to nature and just a few minutes from the financial and commercial heart of the capital. Prestigious schools, medical centers run by internationally recognized specialists and historic sports venues are the usual businesses of one of the districts with the highest per capita income in the city. In line with the exclusivity that characterizes the area, the offer of any type of service is determined by the demanding demand of the residents of one of the most privileged areas of the entire city. The high purchasing power of the inhabitants has boosted the development of real estate projects. In the surroundings you can find places such as the Real Club de Golf Puerta de Hierro, a historic institution founded at the beginning of the century that has more than 220 hectares of land. Also in the vicinity of Puerta de Hierro is the Hippodrome de la Zarzuela, a facility where horse races are held each season that bring together the best athletes in the world in this venue that stands out for its avant-garde architecture. The cultural, sports and leisure offer is complemented by the proximity to the Dehesa de la Villa park, nearby shopping centers such as La Vaguada and the University City. In addition, Puerta de Hierro has a magnificent network of infrastructures that includes metro, commuter and bus stations, as well as quick access to the M-30 and other ring roads of the city.

This flat, located on the first floor of a classic building, offers 152 m² of interior space and has been designed with high quality finishes. Recoletos is synonymous with exclusivity and offers a perfect combination of tranquillity and vibrant city life. Within walking distance are the city's best amenities, such as luxury boutiques on the Golden Mile, gourmet restaurants, and iconic landmarks such as the Retiro Park and the Lázaro Galdiano Museum. Without doubt, the select borough par excellence in Madrid. A stroll through the borough of Salamanca will reveal the most stylish and sought after buildings in the capital: historic buildings with stately halls, spacious interiors and high ceilings. Designed in the late nineteenth century by José de Salamanca y Mayol, Marquis of Salamanca, this district preserves its aristocratic atmosphere, as seen in the many mansions, such as the Italian Embassy, for example. This epicentre of luxury includes the acclaimed "Golden Mile": a shopping area with establishments of the most prestigious brands, such as Dior, Chanel, Prada or Tiffany and Promora. Shops, such as Gallery, BD or Vitra and restaurants, such as Ramsés or No, cater for those who prefer a modern and sophisticated lifestyle. This is a lively and safe area, with wide pavements, almost unlimited parking spaces and an interesting nightlife: Nxt Club, Déjate Besar or Le Boutique Club. There are also art galleries and cultural centres, such as the March Foundation and the Lázaro Galdiano Museum. The area is noted for its luxurious trees and the proximity of the Retiro Park, the city centre's largest green space.

A stroll through the borough of Salamanca will reveal the most stylish and sought after buildings in the capital: historic buildings with stately halls, spacious interiors and high ceilings. Designed in the late nineteenth century by José de Salamanca y Mayol, Marquis of Salamanca, this district preserves its aristocratic atmosphere, as seen in the many mansions, such as the Italian Embassy, for example. This epicentre of luxury includes the acclaimed "Golden Mile": a shopping area with establishments of the most prestigious brands, such as Dior, Chanel, Prada or Tiffany and Promora. Shops, such as Gallery, BD or Vitra and restaurants, such as Ramsés or No, cater for those who prefer a modern and sophisticated lifestyle. This is a lively and safe area, with wide pavements, almost unlimited parking spaces and an interesting nightlife: Nxt Club, Déjate Besar or Le Boutique Club. There are also art galleries and cultural centres, such as the March Foundation and the Lázaro Galdiano Museum. The area is noted for its luxurious trees and the proximity of the Retiro Park, the city centre's largest green space.

2 parking spaces included in the price. Célere Bifaz is located in the new urban development of Los Berrocales, located in the southeast of Madrid, between Ensanche de Vallecas and Santa Eugenia. Its distance to the center of Madrid is 12 kilometers and 19 kilometers to the Madrid-Barajas Airport. It is perfectly connected by road by the M-50 to the east, A3 to the south, M-45 to the west and by the H-8 road that connects Berrocales with the Ensanche de Vallecas, connecting both neighborhoods, which will facilitate access to the Shopping Center, schools, health center, sports center, metro line 1 and urban bus lines, 142, 145, 103, N-9 (night bus). Célere Bifaz is a new residential project with an innovative design and a modern image. This promotion will create a new vision of the Berrocales neighborhood, as it is a 20-story tower. The development will have 87 homes with 1, 2 and 3 bedrooms distributed in two portals, as well as a commercial premises. All homes have a terrace, storage room and garage space, some homes have two spaces. The delivery date is scheduled for the second quarter of 2027. The project has a nice swimming pool for adults and another for children, a toilet area and an outdoor bicycle parking area. Wi-Fi will be available in the common areas. In order to enjoy the views, both the social-gourmet room and the gym have been located on the top floor of the building. In addition, the project has included an outdoor play area for children, where they can enjoy playing in a protected environment, and it also has a garden area. And as we always think about your safety, the urbanization is private, closed with access control and concierge. At Vía Célere we are committed to innovating and implementing increasingly efficient systems, achieving more sustainable buildings that are committed to the environment. The residential has an energy rating A, which represents an estimated energy saving of 83% reducing CO2 emissions and a significant reduction in the energy demand of the complex (cooling and domestic hot water). This qualification translates into an economic saving equivalent to about €1,500 per year, taking as a reference a home with energy rating F. *The images of the promotion are indicative and not definitive.
